name: linkedin-article-to-markdown
description: Extract LinkedIn articles and convert them to Markdown files

scripts.build: npm run build:popup && npm run build:scripts && npm run copy:assets && npm run move:files
scripts.build:scripts: tsc src/content/ContentScript.ts src/content/article-parser.ts --outDir dist/temp-content/content --esModuleInterop --moduleResolution node --target ES2020 --module ESNext && tsc src/background/BackgroundService.ts --outDir dist/temp-background/background --esModuleInterop --moduleResolution node --target ES2020 --module ESNext && tsc src/utils/*.ts --outDir dist/temp-utils --esModuleInterop --moduleResolution node --target ES2020 --module ESNext
scripts.copy:assets: cp src/manifest/manifest.json dist/ && cp -r icons dist/
scripts.move:files: cd dist && cp temp-content/content/content/ContentScript.js . 2>/dev/null || true && cp temp-content/content/content/article-parser.js . 2>/dev/null || true && cp temp-background/background/background/BackgroundService.js . 2>/dev/null || true && cp temp-utils/*.js . 2>/dev/null || true && rm -rf temp-content temp-background temp-utils 2>/dev/null || true && mv index.html popup.html 2>/dev/null || true

author: David Phillip
